```{r library, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(tseries)
library(tsbox) # transform data into time series
library(xts)
library(COVID19) # to get data about covid 19
library(forecast) #arima model
library(vars) #VAR and Causality
```

```{r covid 19 for Atlanta region}
covid19_GA <- covid19("USA", level = 3) %>%
  filter(administrative_area_level_2 == "Georgia",
         administrative_area_level_3 == 'Fulton') %>%
  # filter out days when confirmed is zero or one
  # becasue when it was 2 for a very long time
  filter(confirmed > 2)

# calculate the difference per day
adj_diff_GA <- data.frame(diff(covid19_GA$confirmed))
colnames(adj_diff_GA)[1] = "confirmed"
adj_diff_GA$date = covid19_GA$date[2:length(covid19_GA$date)]

# brief display
head(covid19_GA)
```

```{r overview of covid, message=FALSE}
# plot cumulative cases
# extract for transforming into time series
ts_GA<- covid19_GA %>%
  dplyr::select(date, confirmed) %>%
  ts_xts()

plot.xts(ts_GA,
         main = "Cumulative confirmed cases
         of COVID 19 in Georgia")

# plot daily cases
# first difference
ts_diff_GA <- diff(ts_GA)

# since the end goal is to get residuals
# can add 10 to all values so that there is no negative value
# while having residuals unchanged
adj_diff_GA <- na.omit(ts_diff_GA[,1] + 10)

plot.xts(ts_diff_GA,
         main = "Daily confirmed cases of
         COVID19 in Georgia")
```

### Model the infection
#### Construct the model
```{r GAMM model for covid}
# construct GAMM model from prof. Brown's work

# construct data frame of difference, not time series
covid19_GA_diff <- data.frame(diff(covid19_GA$confirmed) + 10)
  
colnames(covid19_GA_diff)[1] = "confirmed"
covid19_GA_diff$date = covid19_GA$date[2:length(covid19_GA$date)]

# time as integer
covid19_GA_diff$timeInt = as.numeric(covid19_GA_diff$date)
# RIke a copy to avoid perfect collinearity for mixed effect
covid19_GA_diff$timeIid = covid19_GA_diff$timeInt

# GAMM model
gamGA <- gamm4::gamm4(confirmed ~ s(timeInt, k = 70), 
                      random = ~(1|timeIid),
                      data = covid19_GA_diff,
                      family = poisson(link = 'log'))
# currently 70 is the max due to length of data

toPredict = data.frame(time = seq(covid19_GA_diff$date[1], 
                                          covid19_GA_diff$date[length(covid19_GA_diff$date)],
                                  by = '1 day'))
toPredict$timeInt = as.numeric(toPredict$time)

forecast_covid <- data.frame(exp(do.call(cbind, mgcv::predict.gam(gamGA$gam, toPredict, se.fit=TRUE))))
                        
                        
# access residuals
GA_res <- data.frame(covid19_GA_diff$confirmed - forecast_covid$fit)

# transform into time series
GA_res$time = covid19_GA_diff$date
colnames(GA_res)[1] = "residuals"

col_order <- c("time", "residuals")
GA_res <- GA_res[, col_order]

GA_res_ts <- ts_xts(GA_res)

plot.xts(GA_res_ts,
         main = "Daily fluctuation of COVID 19 confirmd cases
         in RI outside its overall trend")
# adf test
adf.test(as.ts(GA_res_ts))
```

```{r get Atlanta data, 2014-2020}
# https://www.atlantapd.org/i-want-to/crime-data-downloads
# download the compressed files

a <- read.csv('/Users/chelseahuang/Downloads/COBRA-2020 (Updated 05_28_2020)/COBRA-2020.csv',
              header = T)
b <- read.csv('/Users/chelseahuang/Downloads/COBRA-2009-2019 (Updated 1_9_2020)/COBRA-2009-2019.csv',
              header = T)

atlanta <- merge(a, b, all = T)
atlanta <- atlanta %>%
  filter(substr(Occur.Date, start = 1, stop = 4) >= '2014')

# add date
atlanta <- atlanta %>%
  mutate(y_month  = substr(Occur.Date, start = 1, stop = 7)) %>%
  mutate(YEAR  = substr(Occur.Date, start = 1, stop = 4)) %>%
  mutate(MONTH = substr(Occur.Date, start = 6, stop = 7))
```

```{r}
# summary of all crime
atlanta_summary <- atlanta %>%
  group_by(UCR.Literal) %>%
  summarise(number_of_crime = n()) %>%
  arrange(desc(number_of_crime))

# bar chart of 5 most frequent crime over the years
atlanta %>%
  filter(UCR.Literal %in% head(atlanta_summary$UCR.Literal, 5)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=UCR.Literal, fill=UCR.Literal)) +
  geom_bar(width = 0.5) +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_classic() +
  labs(y='Number of Crimes',x='Offense Description')

# per MONTH
# exclude May
atlanta %>%
  dplyr::select(MONTH, UCR.Literal, YEAR) %>%
  filter(UCR.Literal %in% atlanta_summary$UCR.Literal[1:5], YEAR == '2020') %>% 
  count(MONTH, UCR.Literal) %>%
  ggplot(aes(MONTH, n, group = UCR.Literal, color = UCR.Literal)) +
  geom_line() +
  scale_color_brewer(palette = "Set1") +
  ggtitle("Monthly frequency of top 5 crime in Atlanta in 2020")

# This dataset doesn't have 'day of the week' yet.

# daily
atlanta %>%
  dplyr::select(Occur.Date, UCR.Literal, YEAR) %>%
  filter(UCR.Literal %in% atlanta_summary$UCR.Literal[1:5], YEAR=='2020') %>%
  count(Occur.Date, UCR.Literal) %>%
  ggplot(aes(Occur.Date, n, group = UCR.Literal, color = UCR.Literal)) +
  geom_line() +
  facet_wrap(~UCR.Literal) +
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Set1", breaks = rev(levels(atlanta_summary$UCR.Literal[1:5]))) +
  ggtitle("Frequency of top 5 crime in Atlanta in 2020")

# year to year comparison
atlanta %>%
  dplyr::select(y_month, MONTH, UCR.Literal, YEAR) %>%
  filter(UCR.Literal %in% atlanta_summary$UCR.Literal[1:5]) %>%
  count(YEAR, MONTH, UCR.Literal) %>%
  na.omit() %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=MONTH, y=n, group = YEAR, color = as.character(YEAR))) +
  geom_line() +
  facet_wrap(~UCR.Literal) +
  ggtitle("year to year comparison of the top 5 crime in atlanta in the past 6 years")

```

## VAR 
### Step1 : Extract cases
```{r extract cases}
# extract top 5 crime
top5crime <- atlanta %>%
  filter(UCR.Literal %in% head(atlanta_summary$UCR.Literal, 5)) %>%
  group_by(Occur.Date, UCR.Literal) %>%
  tally() %>%
  spread(UCR.Literal, n)

# rename columns
colnames(top5crime) <- c('time',
                         'assault',
                         "autotheft",
                         "burglary",
                         "larceny_fromvehicle",
                         'larceny_nonvehicle')
top5crime <- na.omit(top5crime)
# create time series
top5crime_xts <- ts_xts(top5crime[,1:2])

for (i in (3:ncol(top5crime))){
  temp_xts <- ts_xts(top5crime[, c(1,i)])
  top5crime_xts <- merge(top5crime_xts, temp_xts)
}

# extract difference, change per day
top5crime_diff <- na.omit(diff(top5crime_xts))
```

### Step 2: Construct combined time series
```{r top 5 crime VAR}
# specify common time range
# start from when covid was a thing
# end with 1 day before today's date
common_time <- seq.Date(start(GA_res_ts), as.Date("2020-05-25"), by = "day")

# combine time series of crime and covid
combined_diff <- merge(top5crime_diff[paste(common_time[1],
                                            common_time[length(common_time)],
                                            sep = "/")],
                       GA_res_ts[paste(common_time[1],
                                            common_time[length(common_time)],
                                            sep = "/")])

```

### Step 3: Plot each crime with covid
```{r plot together}
for (i in 1:(ncol(combined_diff) - 1)){
  plotrix::twoord.plot(common_time,
                       combined_diff[,i],
                       common_time,
                       combined_diff$residuals,
                       type = c("l","l"),
                       xaxt = "n",
                       rylab = "number of daily fluctuation of covid 19 cases",
                       ylab = paste("daily change in", colnames(combined_diff)[i]))
                       
}
```

### Step 5: Construct VAR model
```{r construct var, warning = FALSE}
# variable selection based on AIC
optimal_assault <- VARselect(na.omit(combined_diff)[,c(1,6)], type = 'none', lag.max = 10)
optimal_autotheft <- VARselect(na.omit(combined_diff)[,c(2,6)], type = 'none', lag.max = 10)
optimal_burglary <- VARselect(na.omit(combined_diff)[,c(3,6)], type = 'none', lag.max = 10)
optimal_larceny_fromvehicle <- VARselect(na.omit(combined_diff)[,c(4,6)], type = 'none', lag.max = 10)
optimal_larceny_nonvehicle <- VARselect(na.omit(combined_diff)[,c(5,6)], type = 'none', lag.max = 10)

# use AIC as selection criteria
VAR_assault <- VAR(y=as.ts(na.omit(combined_diff)[,c(1,6)]), p=optimal_assault$selection[1])
VAR_autotheft <- VAR(y=as.ts(na.omit(combined_diff)[,c(2,6)]),
                     p=optimal_autotheft$selection[1])
VAR_burglary <- VAR(y=as.ts(na.omit(combined_diff)[,c(3,6)]),
                    p=optimal_burglary$selection[1])
VAR_larceny_fromvehicle <- VAR(y=as.ts(na.omit(combined_diff)[,c(4,6)]),
                               p=optimal_larceny_fromvehicle$selection[1])
VAR_larceny_nonvehicle <- VAR(y=as.ts(na.omit(combined_diff)[,c(5,6)]),
                              p=optimal_larceny_nonvehicle$selection[1])
```

### Step 6: Granger Causality test

```{r}
causality(VAR_assault, cause = colnames(combined_diff)[1])
causality(VAR_assault, cause = "residuals")
```

```{r}
causality(VAR_autotheft, cause = colnames(combined_diff)[2])
causality(VAR_autotheft, cause = "residuals")
```

causality(VAR_burglary, cause = colnames(combined_diff)[3])
causality(VAR_burglary, cause = "residuals")
```

causality(VAR_larceny_fromvehicle, cause = colnames(combined_diff)[4])
causality(VAR_larceny_fromvehicle, cause = "residuals")
```

```{r}
causality(VAR_larceny_nonvehicle, cause = colnames(combined_diff)[5])
causality(VAR_larceny_nonvehicle, cause = "residuals")
```
